website_summaries.verdict: Based on general user feedback, the Propet Stability Walker exceeded the expectations of consumers when it came to comfort. The owners were especially delighted that the shoe was stable and supportive, and was able to accommodate custom orthotics. However, issues were pointed out by buyers which included the inconsistent sizing and width, the stiffness of the product, and the poor construction which resulted in blisters. But in the end, it was still considered a reliable walking footgear by most of the reviewers.
pros: A vast majority of owners claimed that the Propet Stability Walker delivered comfort during extended periods of walking and standing
The fit was deemed perfect by a large number of buyers
it was roomy at the ball section and the toe box, but snug at the heel
The stability of the trainer delighted many users because it prevented the foot from excessively rolling in or out
Numerous reviewers stated that the upper delivered exceptional support, especially at the ankle
The deep toe well allowed the footgear to accommodate custom orthotics as well as ankle-foot orthosis (AFO) braces, said a lot of purchasers
Plenty of people who have plantar fasciitis and neuropathy praised how the product relieved foot, leg, knee, and back pain
The merchandise’s quality build impressed multiple shoppers
cons: A significant number of critics ranted about the inconsistent sizing and fit
it was either too short and narrow or was too long and wide compared to other Propet models of the same measurement
A lot of wearers griped that the seams inside the toe box and the high collar caused chafing and blistering
A minority of consumers commented that the cushioning felt hard and uncomfortable, and needed to be broken in
The durability of the footwear displeased a few consumers
the laces easily broke, the sole got worn out quickly, and the stitches unthreaded with regular use

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe Gone Bad?
customer_reviews.text: After previously buying and wearing 6 pairs of this shoe, the latest pair I bought was measurably more narrow than the prior pairs (of the same labeled size) ... and certain aspects of the shoe were of a lesser quality that the prior pairs. I don't know if the latest pair was mislabeled, was a counterfeit pair, or if the manufacturer has changed the specs for the shoe ... but I'm not pleased with the latest pair and I won't buy this shoe again ... after previously being very pleased with prior pairs of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: RKC

customer_reviews.title: Save your $$$  Do NOT buy these shoes,  poor quality and workmanship
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes primarily for the supposed leather uppers. Initially fit comfortably, if not a little big. Not enough padding in the soles and little, to no, arch support. Wearing a EEEE shoe my choices are quite limited so I elected not to return them Within one month shoes began stretching to the point of almost falling off. Within two months, threads on the bottom wearing almost flat. I've had them slightly over 3 months and the top of the right shoe, (near the right toe) has a 3"rip-seam opened up. Shoes headed for the trash! Save your $$$, better off investing in so Walmart sneakers, they wear better and longer
customer_reviews.author: Sabina Terrades

customer_reviews.title: Good sneakers for Hobbit feet like mine.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many different shoes and boots from Propet. This is my first sneaker however. The shoes are one of the better ones I have purchased. While the top part of the shoe is okay material which may wear quickly, the sole is of better quality. Some of the shoes I have purchased from Propet have horrible soles consisting of foam type rubber. These shoes have good quality rubber that looks like it will wear evenly and last a while. Propet has been my go to for wide shoes that are in the moderately priced category. Give them a try if you have Hobbit feet like me.
customer_reviews.author: Dan D.

customer_reviews.title: I've worn these for six months and am very happy with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these for six months and am very happy with the quality. They aren't quite as comfortable as more expensive shoes in this category, but those brands have not held up for me as well as these have. The wider base is very nice if you have any stability issues as well. My only complaint would be that my pair came a bit smaller then the size suggested. I'm going to try the next width up next time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Lippincott

customer_reviews.title: big change from previous model
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed. My previous Propet 13 5E (from Zappos) is the first shoe I've ever been able to comfortably wear because of its width. So when these wore out, I simply ordered another pair. Look at the pictures and you can see what happened. The new shoe (same model number and size) is much narrower. I included a bottom picture to dispel someone thinking that the new shoe is simply not broken in. It is actually a full 1/2 inch narrower and I can't wear them, had to return.
customer_reviews.author: rljknj

customer_reviews.title: Right shoe obviously more narrow than left shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs size 10 regular width. Left felt little snug, right shown obviously more narrow than left. Wore for several days and both stretched slightly. Left feels good on foot, but right little toe almost feels dislocated. Tried other pair, and both shoes feel even. Right shoe first pair even looks visually different as if upper incorrectly attached to sole. I should have sent back immediately but was hoping foot would eventually stretch it out. The second pair size after wearing for awhile actually feels good. I would have given 4 stars for second pair. Seems like decent everyday house and yard shoe for the price. I wouldn't try to play basketball or do much running in them.
customer_reviews.author: T Horn

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable and fit well me well
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a pair for about 6 months now. They are comfortable and fit well me well. What I don't like is that they are falling apart. The paper thin leather is peeling off the tongue on both shoes, seems are coming undone, exposing the foam like material underneath. The inside lining is also deteriorating. And I've had to replace the shoestrings because the eyelets (D-shaped rings) are not smooth and cut them. I have purchased Propet shoes for many years, and have been very dissapointed with my last 2 purchases. I may have to spend a little more and buy New Balance again. They should not wear out so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: Great to have extra wide available.  Attractive and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice leather shoes that I got for a really good price. It is hard to find the wide width that I need for a reasonable price. They are comfortable to wear. So many that I looked at showed pictures of the sole falling off. I think this is a new phenomenon. Years ago folks would have been shocked if that happened unless they came from the dime store. That is what happened to the shoes I needed to replace with these. I checked and the sole seems securely attached to the upper on these. Very nice so far.
customer_reviews.author: wlr/buddysbuddy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for everything except moderate exercise.
customer_reviews.text: I like just about everything about these shoes. Very stable. Good arch support. They even look pretty good for casual wear. However, when I step up my walking pace or engage in somewhat aggressive exercise, I feel like I'm going to step out of the shoe. I think I'm able to lace up my other exercise shoes closer to the ankle which makes them feel more secure. I have drop-foot which may make the feeling worse. Other than that, I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Average Guy

customer_reviews.title: Superior shoe
customer_reviews.text: This companies shoes are superior quality and workmanship. This is my third pair from them (2 from Amazon &1 from Medicare) and they always fit to the description advertised. Even when I had a issue on one pair the seller fully supported my issue and made it right for me immediately. If you are in need of medically supported shoes Propet is the shoe to research and purchase. Well made and designed, great looking, form insert ready, and a great customer support system in place.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J

customer_reviews.title: The shoes were comfortable, and fit well
customer_reviews.text: I came back to leave a review and was very surprised to realize I had only had these less than 6 months, and they are completely falling apart. Bottoms peeling off, the side stitching has ripped open, and the shoe has broken down. I walk my dogs less than a mile each day, but otherwise don't put any unusual wear and tear on shoes, other than I am a big fit. The shoes were comfortable, and fit well. My only complaint then is that they didn't even last a full 6 months before needing replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Light Weight, Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Good Comfortable Shoes. Bought these for my husband. We are OLD PEOPLE so we are really into comfortable, long lasting clothes and shoes. These are both. My husband has been wearing this brand in this size for years. He cannot find the size which fits well most places that we shop, so he has me order them for him. He likes these shoes and can always get the size he needs.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Propet Men's Stability Walkers
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like these when I first got them because they don't have much of a rocker sole; and I had bought them for exercise walking. They also require some breaking in, which I wasn't accustomed to. However, they were very comfortable for grocery shopping and running errands so I used them mostly for that. Then I sprained my ankle badly and found that they were the only shoe to provide the support I wanted while healing. Once broken in, they were also more comfortable for brisk walks. My first pair is almost two years old now and still isn't badly worn; but I recently bought another pair just to have on hand. The fit is as expected.
customer_reviews.author: customer99

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. I put a lot of hard miles on them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a few months before a trip to Rome so they would have a chance to break in. Absolutely comfortable and casual. They were perfect in Rome for all but the fancy restaurant! 8 days straight of many many miles per day over some difficult terrain. Cobblestone streets, and ancient ruin sites were the most uneven. Lots of stairs and sidewalks, too. I wear them every day now since they are more comfortable than the New Balance I was wearing before. Haven’t noticed any of the sole separation issues I saw from other reviewers. All in all I love them. And a great price, too!
customer_reviews.author: Sample This

customer_reviews.title: Measurement 101, Please!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Propet shoes for years. I have severe plantar fasciitis, and need an extra wide shoe to accommodate my custom orthopedic orthodics. The original size 12 5E US is what I ordered. That’s not what I got. Had to go up to a 13 5E US and stuff the toe with Kleenex. Ordered another pair for a spare, and they were too narrow. Had to go up to a size 14 5E US. I guess Propet found a cheaper sweatshop to manafacture their shoes, but forgot to give them a tape measure. Ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: lex

customer_reviews.title: and I expect they will get better after a break in period
customer_reviews.text: As for stability, these are great--the sides and midsole are strong and fairly rigid, so there is no noticeable pronation, which is the most important reason for me to have gotten these shoes. They are a bit snug, though, with a narrow toe box, and not enough room in the heel or toe for a support insole, and this is after I returned my first pair for one a half size larger. This is only after a couple of wears, and I expect they will get better after a break in period, so I'm keeping them, and using a partial insole to add a little bit of extra support for my fallen arches.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Lightweight Propét Men's Stability Walker Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these for my husband who is hard to fit with a 15 shoe. These fit exact as stated. He loves them as they are lightweight and make his feet look so much smaller. He likes the fit and the way they feel in the arch and overall fit. He like them so well I ordered two more pair for him as you never know how long the manufacturer will make them. I highly recommend them as my husband is really hard to fit and these really fit him like a sneaker should fit and are light weight which he loves. The color is true as pictured as well!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer!

customer_reviews.title: comfortable for retail work
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable! Fit my foot on the first try, very amazing. I'm leaving new balance for this brand. I love the exterior fabric, but it scuffs super easy. Not a huge deal as long as the shoe holds up. Update. Less than one year of ownership and this has fallen apart. The soles are falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Warren III

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 pairs - 1 white and 1 black. They both have the same label inside as a pair from shoesonline.com that I recieved 2 years back. Label text: M2034 - USA 71⁄2 3E(X) - Made In China - Leather Upper. But sadly the new pairs seem to be 1⁄2-1 size smaller (EU 41 -> EU 40) (shorter and narrower) as if it was women sizes instead of MENS. And it is both upper leather and the rubber sole which is smaller. I havn't had use for the new shoes until now, so I havn't had them one and tested size earlier. My return window closed 13 days ago and the boxes are binned weeks ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they look great, so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My husband has nephropathy in his feet and legs so at times he falls. These shoes really provide a stability in his walking. When I bought them I questioned the ability to stabilize so I was a doubting Thomas. But, they look great, so comfortable, sturdy, and a good fit and yes they stabilize his step . My husband was able to put them on and go to work No break in time needed. He liked them so much he asked that I buy a second pair and these are those. Great shoe!
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Shoe falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful shoe,not as much padding under foot,i am a 5 day a week walker,bought these shoes in past and have held up great,this time,2-3 weeks into using them just walking ,they are falling apart!! Cannot believe this as they were my goto shoe for exercising.. fix this problem!! Will have to look elsewhere now..☹
customer_reviews.author: Steven Earnest

customer_reviews.title: Screwy size
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are nice but the sizing is off. The seller's description said order a size larger than your regular size, but one of the reviews said the size was right on. My regular size is 8 1/2M. I went with the advice of the seller and ordered 9M which is just a tiny bit to big. My heal slips up and down against the back of the shoe. I have been wearing them inside the house trying to decide what to do. I'm afraid that the 8 1/2M would probably be too tight.
customer_reviews.author: AlB

customer_reviews.title: You may want to order one size larger either in width or length
customer_reviews.text: I sent them back because they were too small they seem like they were pretty nice shoes well-built stylish. So I can't really give a good review or a bad review simply because they didn't fit me. I ordered an 11 d which is my normal size you may want to go either one witdth or one length longer depending upon your foot.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM R JOHNSTON

customer_reviews.title: the stability walker sneaker is a subpar shoe  whoever the manufacture is just sucks at what they do
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Propet stability walker shoes for several years and loved them, than for some reason propet changed manufacturer and call them stability walker sneaker. the new manufacturer is making a subpar product. the shoes fall apart within months of normal use and the shoe size is not the same. i have contacted Propet which is how i know the changed manufacture, and propet's response is basiclly oh well i had bad ankles and feet need a wider foot platform which is what the stability walker gave me. the stability walker sneaker does not i am looking for a shoe that is like the stabiltiy walker was. does anyone out there know of one?
customer_reviews.author: Gordon C

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are a dream come true
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different shoes and could not get a pair that gave me the support I needed or a secure fit. I finally found the perfect walking shoes. These give great support and fit perfect. The arch support makes them super comfy. I can't thank the manufacture enough!! Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debi

customer_reviews.title: Found these to be a comfortable, well-made shoe
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these shoes as an aid to help with a case of Plantar Faciitus. Found these to be a comfortable, well-made shoe. The wide (3X) runs a little wider than expected, but you can remedy this fact by wearing a thick cotton sox. No shoe can anticipate or measure the arch support you need; but this shoe will accomodate arched inserts quite nicely. The shoe has high back for good ankle support and plenty of lace holes for a tight laced fit. VERY PLEASED WITH THIS SHOE . WOULD DEFINATELY PURCHASE THEM AGAIN!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Scribe

customer_reviews.title: omg. FANTASTIC FIT AND COMFY
customer_reviews.text: i have custom medical support inserts that are very thick. Also, I have very wide feet. These shoes fit perfect and look high end. The shoe being as deep as it is, easily accommodates my custom insert and the generous width fits my wide feet perfectly. For the price, this is the best all leather upper shoe on the market. I plan on buying more of this style in different colors and leathers. I would recommend these shoes for anyone with hard to fit wide feet who have medical issues with their feet. BUY THESE SHOES. ****************************************** Its been a week and the shoes feel great and look fantastic. I hope to be buy more soon.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel the KingTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: Propet Stability Walkers for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Propet Walkers now for several years. These are a true fitting shoe that will eventually stretch out some and become even more comfortable. The new pair feels like it could take an hour long walk in them already. The only problems I have is with the shoe laces, then tend to break in less than a year of use. And if you wear the shoes in wet grass they will leak, I fix that with some leak-proofing polish or spray around the seams.
customer_reviews.author: cybershopper

customer_reviews.title: Wide is a relative term
customer_reviews.text: Wide is a relative term, if I need a wide shoe at the ball of my feet you think I'd need some toe room as well but the blisters say otherwise. Apparently these shoes are diabetics that have already lost there toes so they dont need space for them anymore. Otherwise seem relatively sturdy and functional
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Quack Quack
customer_reviews.text: When I first put them on I wanted to return them, the insoles felt hard and hurt my arches. However, when I put them on the next day I forgot I had them on. These are the most comfortable shoes I have had in a long time but I still have a slight problem with the insole hurting my big toe, it is tolerable so a four star rating. I think the shoes are fine but my ancestors must have been ducks making it difficult to find shoes that allow for my toe box width and my big toe length. On the plus side, I don't need snowshoes. Yes I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: glcline

customer_reviews.title: Spend all your time trimming the souls back where they come unglued
customer_reviews.text: Very Comfortable, However I would not buy again, The Soul has Gray pads, I think just for decoration, but they come unglued around the edges and tend to catch on Throw rungs and floor mats. they tend to Trip you, if you are not careful. you can spend all your time cutting them off , but you shouldn't have to do this on a new pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: James C Reid

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow in the toe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in size 12 5e. I normally wear 12 4e but these run very, very narrrow. Too late to return them, but I wore them twice to work out on the treadmill and ended up with 3/4 inch blisters on both little toes. Probably one of the most uncomfortable athletic shoes I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.author: Bobo

customer_reviews.title: Not what they have been in the past
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Propet Stability Walkers on and off for the last 15 years. The last two pairs purchased did not fit well. It seems the design and quality has changed. I wear a 12 extra wide. They are very tight at the bridge of the foot and seem to narrow at the toe box. They are not comfortable. I normally wear Brooks Adrenaline GTS19 and they fit great. I needed a darker pair of shoes so I bought these Propet Stability Walkers in brown. I will be sending them
customer_reviews.author: Old man JC

customer_reviews.title: Feet don't hurt any more
customer_reviews.text: ordered 1/2 size larger as suggested - ended up with a full size larger. Loose but seem to be fine so far. I have always used New Balance in the past, but the last two pares made my feet hurt after a few hours of use. That was a 4E size, the biggest width they have. I think they have become narrower. The 5E Propet don't bother my feet with extended wear time. Don't know how long they will last, but my feet aren't hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and great for proper alignment
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great! I didn’t even realize how bad my old shoes were until I started wearing these! I also didn’t realize how out of alignment I was before these shoes. Apparently I tend to roll my feet out to the sides, which makes my feet, ankles and legs hurt when walking around for more than 30 minutes. These gave me a pep in my step and felt great to walk in for hours.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Agnew

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought these as my first pair of Medicare diabetic shoes was by this brand. Found this particular model to be comfortable for my everyday use, and I have a Propet walking shoe for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Rambling S.

customer_reviews.title: These shoes fit well and are comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this size from Propet, before. These shoes fit well and are comfortable and supportive. I am very satisfied with Propet products and am very satisfied with these shoes. I have found Propet shoes to be durable and long-lasting. I have several pairs of different models and use them for everything from hiking, work shoes and even to moderately dressy events. I have feet of slightly different sizes and the size/width combination offered by Propet works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T.

customer_reviews.title: Narrower than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase a pair last year and I wore them out. They lasted as long as I would have liked. I just got my second pair today but they seem narrower. I ordered the 9.5 xxwide which is supporting be 5E. They seem narrower than the last pair. Perhaps it’s because I haven’t broken them I like the last pair.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find a shoe this wide but these make the grade.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I was having a problem with swollen feet caused by nueropathy related to a rare disorder I had called Guillian Barre' Syndrome. In my quest to learn to walk again I wore blisters on several toes and needed a wider shoe to accommodate the dressings as well as the swelling in general. These shoes have served that purpose. Plus they are stable, relatively inexpensive, and good looking.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Narrow at the toes
customer_reviews.text: I can only wear these for a couple hours before my toes start to feel crowded. I bought super wide, and they fit great--except for my toes. The shoes, no matter the width, are narrow at the toes.
customer_reviews.author: fleonard

customer_reviews.title: Great support shoe!
customer_reviews.text: The shoe looks great! It is not as flexible as I thought, but it fulfills my need, even though it was a little tight. after wearing the shoe for a month, I have already ordered a second pair. The price is good. I give it 4 stars since I did have to break it in. (most shoes I order do not need a break-in period).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Michaud

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, but -
customer_reviews.text: Bought 8 pair over the last 3 years times for under $60 each. Time to re-up, I log on, now listing for $84.95?! Not cool. Shoes are very wide if you need it. Durable enough at the previous price, not at $85. Looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Citracet

customer_reviews.title: Initial Impression: Good, Sturdy Shoe, Plenty Wide, Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: My new Propet Men's Stability Walker shoes are plenty wide and fairly comfortable. These are not cu$tom made $hoe$ and they did require some breaking in, but this is to be expected with new shoes, especially with uniquely wide feet like mine. They seem plenty sturdy and quality appears to be good, but I haven't worn them long enough to confirm it. I walk 2-miles a day and will update my review after I've put 500 miles on them(half the manufacturer's mileage warranty). To sum it up, my new Propets are plenty wide, seem sturdy, are fairly comfortable, and appear to be a good value. I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: F. Steve Adam

customer_reviews.title: Felt broken in the first day
customer_reviews.text: I got my first pair of Stability walkers 25 years ago and promptly lost weight -- I tend to walk more when my feet aren't hurting -- and this pair is no different in terms of feeling good from Day One.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoes, good fit
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable out of the box. Typically, shoes bite at the ball or the heal. They were a little tight right out of the box, but that is expected until they conform to your feet. I also like that the sole is one piece. I had similar shoes that had layered soles and they fell apart rather quickly. I hope these will not. The size and width options on Amazon appear to be consistant across several brands, which is very helpful in finding the right shoe every time. Thanks for that. I do not plan to visit another store front for my 15 3Es.
customer_reviews.author: J. Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Great supportive shoe
customer_reviews.text: My husband is diabetic and has hammer toes, so was getting fitted for shoes at the place he gets his orthotic inserts - Expensive and he didn't like the support of the Propet shoe they ordered him. I was familiar with this model, and he loves it. He wears it to work out, walking and everywhere else. His feet are happy, they wear well, they are roomy enough for orthotics, and the price is right! Also, the men's model comes in a variety of colors that look nice with jeans and casual wear (hint to Propet - offer something besides black and white for Women!!).
customer_reviews.author: Patty J

customer_reviews.title: Good For Wide Feet
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to find wide sneakers for people with small ankles. They fit as well as can be expected. I purchase silicone inserts separately to allow the sneakers to fit snugly in the ankles, which works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer in New England

customer_reviews.title: Propét Men's Stability Walker
customer_reviews.text: Propét Stability Walker - not the same as previously manufactured. Must be new shoe forms / last. Fixed a seam problem over the outer-top of the arch w/ a lambs wool insert to remediate a pinch-point
customer_reviews.author: Gary Clark

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes; runs small
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Propel Men's Stability Walker Waling Shoe in brown for better support because of my bad knees. Based on the recommendations of others, I bought a 1/2 size larger initially, but that turned out to be too small. I purchased a full size larger and those fit great. I'm happy with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: MarkSD

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Propets and by far the best. One thing I have noticed with Propet is that their widths are narrower than stated. Just get the next width up and they are great. These are so comfortable that I am not in a rush to get them off after work.
customer_reviews.author: Al Madding

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and durability
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy 6 foot 7 360 lbs,. I bought these shoes for my Disney world trip. My pedometer says I have put over 20miles on them and they are holding up pretty well. They have good insoles,(I would usually have crushed them by now). They are not the prettiest shoes I have owned but they are just as good if not better than my much more expensive name brand shoes.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: They are not the Propets I used to have
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's been too long or the model was different, but a previous pair of Propet shoes drove e to this purchase. These are a good quality shoe, but I would have enjoyed higher arches, and a more flexible and cushier sole.
customer_reviews.author: J.Kirley

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted walking shoes, run 1/2 size small
customer_reviews.text: These are well made walking shoes, however they do run about 1/2 size small, specifically in the toe box. Otherwise, great shoes and worth the price offered on Amazon.com.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but only lasted about 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these pretty much everyday for just office shoes, and they were adequately comfortable after replacing the inserts (which I do with all my shoes). They started to come apart after about 5 months (toe peeled back). Since that is a tripping hazard, into the garbage they went. The shoelaces were horrid. I don't know how to describe it, but there is an inner cord covered with and outer weave, the inner cord gets tangled/twisted in knots, but it is inside the tube of the outer weave, so you cant untangle it... Just an effen mess. PASS
customer_reviews.author: jayMac

customer_reviews.title: WAY TO THIN
customer_reviews.text: Have worn these shoes for past 4 years, now they are all of a sudden to thin. Last pair was tight and these are very tight. All my other shoes are fine. Guess they think to save by cutting them narrower. Am returning and will shop alternate brands from now on.
customer_reviews.author: mike henkin

customer_reviews.title: Same Size I always order, feels like a size larger
customer_reviews.text: I always order the same size Propet, have for over ten years. This version of the stability Walker feels like it is a size larger. Checked the tongue to see if they put the wrong size in the box. Nope, correct size, made in China, with Chinese quality control. So what's a size more or less? Very easy to slip on and off without untying. Other than size, this shoe seems good. It was too late to return. Last pair wasn't worn out, but sole separated from shoe. Cheap Chinese glue? Next purchase will be another brand, sigh ...
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Returned for a Refund
customer_reviews.text: Returned the shoes. The design and workmanship poor. The shoes have a seam that runs across my toes, creating discomfort for my right foot, and pain for my left. Glue seeped out along some edges of the sole...not uniform construcion. The size was correct, if only the design didn't cut into the width with the misplaced seam.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Chmielewski

customer_reviews.title: Good walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made shoe, insole is firm but quickly complies toot contour, sole is flexible but maintains firmness underfoot while walking. Suggested to order 1/2 half size large but not needed. Seller was quick to replace with 1/2 size smaller with expedited shipping. Return was easy.
customer_reviews.author: ibdave

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes diuscovered
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable shoes I have found. They provide good support for all-day wear. I like them so much I have two pair that I alternate days wearing them and I have a pair in reserve when one of them starts looking too bad to wear, which is a year or more. I have needed to replace the 36 inch shoe laces after about 6 months of wear. Best shoes I have found.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Good, but would be GREAT with a cushioned insert!
customer_reviews.text: I finally found a shoe with the width that I now need. I use this shoe for work and general informal use. I would have given this shoe 5 stars if it had better cushioning. It seems to be a good shoe for me and I will likely buy another pair (though a half size shorter), especially if I can find a good cushion insert. I am on my feet all day and as is, I am happy to get these off at the end of the work day. Previously I was wearing a pair of Avias which had adequate cushioning, but they just weren't quite wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: EmAndEm

customer_reviews.title: What Happened???
customer_reviews.text: Learning about company Propet in summer 2013 from a local shoe store, this was my third pair of shoes from this dynamic brand. They really know comfort with their dress shoes. Dr. Scholl's can certainly learn a thing or two from this brand! When I found out they made sneakers I flipped and ordered this pair, but the results are not the same. What happened? These sneakers are hard and I find no comfort in them. Can you say, "Return?"
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyD

customer_reviews.title: VERY COMFORTABLE, SIZE JUST RIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is very light on the foot. Size is exactly right for my 14EEE. Will update my review after more wear, just received my order & am very pleased. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a problem with this shoe. Left foot feels okay, right foot starts to hurt just behind the two smallest toes after I wear it for more than a few hours. I took the inserts out and they look fine and both symmetrical, and I don't feel or see any lumps or malformations in either shoe. Going to try them with some inserts from the store but the ones that came with it are sadly nicely made and probably contributed heavily to the cost of the shoe. I'll update on whether new inserts helps the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes I love them comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I love my shoes. Keep in mind if you have a wide foot as I do it wasn’t as wide as I am normally used to coming from other shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: First time buying shoes on the ineternet. Stores never have my size in stock. So I thought I'd give it shot. Couldnt be any happier with fit. Nice shoes, very comfortable. Will buy another pair. Helps out with my plantar fascitis/heel spur problem tremendously. My heel feels a lot better now. If you suffer from plantar fascitis give this shoe a try and try these inserts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tmanqz

customer_reviews.title: Don't live up to the hype of past reviews
customer_reviews.text: I've rated this shoe as mediocre. Width is not true, shoe materials feel like cheap faux leather, and there is no real cushioning to speak of. The length is comparable to new balance trainers, which is to say they are a bit long. Compare to new balance mx trainer or nike air monarch id pick either of those two before these for build quality and cushion. These are not a $90+ shoe as they're advertised and not worth th $60 i paid. Pass on these.
customer_reviews.author: T.E.Marca

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for these Propet Men's M2034 Stability Walker Sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most comfortable "tennis" shoe I have ever had. I need wide shoes, and finding them is a challenge. I usually buy 4E wides and I still have problems with many of the big name brand athletic shoes. These Propet Men's M2034 Stability Walker Sneaker are what I have been looking for. They fit and they are comfortable. I think they run just slightly on the large size as I was able to wear a 3E in this shoe.... and they have more room than any of the 4E's I have had. And they are very well priced........
customer_reviews.author: skypros

customer_reviews.title: Easy to walk in these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I sometimes need a cane to walk, however, I do not need a cane with theses shoes. They fit me perfectly and keep my gait steady. They are very comfortable and i can wear all day.
customer_reviews.author: SilverHalide

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, stable, and fashionable.  This is my second pair.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my first air of Propet a few years ago after tiring of the typical shoe store offerings, big box stores, and factory outlets. I had never heard of Propet but I figured what the heck, the warranty sounded great. They lived up to the warranty and beyond. I wore the shoes nearly everyday for more than two years and I can still wear them today. I pronate and wear shoes out in a hurry but usually only on one side. The Propet has worn evenly and remains a sturdy support. I know I will love my second pair as much as the first!
customer_reviews.author: Randy T.

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart at 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: I have big feet. This severely limits what shoes are available for purchase, and I've spent a lot of time with the Propet brand over the years. I put a lot of wear on shoes, and consider getting a solid year out of them to be a good deal. This particular design is falling apart at four months. Specifically, the rubber tread is delaminating off of the sole. The quality has gone down on this brand in recent years, but this is probably the most disappointing pair of shoes so far. Here's hoping I can find something else.
customer_reviews.author: K. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like em at first
customer_reviews.text: Didn't like em at first. They made my feet hurt and as a type 1 diabetic, that defeated the point. Tried them again a few weeks later and they're fantastic! Perhaps my blood sugar had just beaten them up before. My left leg is shorter than right so need to fit half an inch lift in shoe without it becoming uncomfortable. Not a problem with these. Plan on getting them in other colors asap!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Price

customer_reviews.title: Uggly but sutable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: An old ugly shoe I used to wear for work, I wanted the Sanford model but Propet, in their infinite wisdom, discontinued it With size 11 5E feet watcha goin to do?
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, Order True to Size
customer_reviews.text: Most of the reviews I read before ordering these shoes said that the size of this shoe runs small. So, I ordered one half size larger (10EE) and I had to return them because they were too large. I just received the shoes that I ordered true to size (9.5 EE) and they fit perfectly! I love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Arvmc

customer_reviews.title: Ten year customer...
customer_reviews.text: Have owned about 20 pairs in the past ten years. As a builder, General Contractor and cabinetmaker, I spend all day on my feet. Propet's Stability Walkers are the best thing that ever happened to these 71 year old feet. I do use an Orthopedic insert (Lynco), but the shoe itself is the foundation that provides a comfortable experience that has warded off foot problems for over a decade.
customer_reviews.author: Karlac

customer_reviews.title: Great walking shoes
customer_reviews.text: I order a pair of these every few months. I love them. I use the old ones for getting dirty and the new ones for longer walks.
customer_reviews.author: D. OGLEE

customer_reviews.title: If it's half as good as the first
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I've owned. If it's half as good as the first, I'll be happy. I had the first pair for 5 years, wore them almost every day, replaced insoles a number of times and am reluctantly replacing them because the sole is wearing thin. I have a balance and gait problem and these shoes definitely improve my walking. The gray is very handsome and can pass as a dress shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Solid leather which is required in the hospital. Very comfortable. Good support and I walk A LOT!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Limerick

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistant Size
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased Propet Stability Walkers for will over 10 years and was completely satisfied. However within the past 3 years the fit has not been consistent. Sometimes they actually have the wrong size label sewn onto the shoe tongue. Other times they are too narrow so I never know what I'm going to receive. The last 2 out of 3 pairs have NOT fit.
customer_reviews.author: John Jay Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: not easy to find....
customer_reviews.text: 5E width is not an easy find. Good Looking, good fitting, So far holding up very well. The non-slip sole is appreciated and the neutral color is good with denim and tan and black working plants...this is a true working man's "sneaker" great for summer work.....Back to boots when the weather changes....
customer_reviews.author: Brigadier

customer_reviews.title: Very poor purchase
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were advertised as being narrow but they were indicated as E inside the shoe. The leather is very hard even after polishing a few times it did not soften. It seams on the inside rub your foot until you get a blister. Of all the items purchased through Amazon this would be one that I would never order again.
customer_reviews.author: Louis C.

customer_reviews.title: Bit narrow toe box
customer_reviews.text: They feel like the width is correct, but the shoes have a rather narrow toe box. To my feet, that defeats the purpose or readon for wide width shoes. My pinkie toes get a bit of a rub. Otherwise comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wess

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the width accuracy!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased another pair of these as I was able to use inserts to provide arch support in my last pair. Another reviewer already commented on this but these are much too narrow to be a 5X. I have trouble believing these were made by the same company as last time as the width was acceptable last time. I will keep them and try to stretch them out but this is the last pair I will ever buy online ... no quality standard on sizing.
customer_reviews.author: chesskix

customer_reviews.title: Old Man Shoes
customer_reviews.text: My wife mocked me, and rightfully so. Even my grandpa would have laughed at these. Happily sent them back.
customer_reviews.author: DenaMan

customer_reviews.title: I ordered the 11 EEEE & they really are 11 EEEEE
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 11 EEEE & they really are 11 EEEEE Lots of shoes advertised as EEEE have EE soles with a slightly wider upper sewn on. NOT PROPET!!! These babies are wide. wide soles, wide uppers..... wide wide wide I wish I could afford the propet work boots!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Returning the first pair was so easy. Amazon did essentially everything
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have been a very positive experience. First size arrived and was just too small. My husband is breaking in the bigger size and has commented these seem slightly large, but wearable. Returning the first pair was so easy. Amazon did essentially everything. I had to only print the return mailing lable and drop off at a UPS store. The UPS staff could not have been nicer. Hoorah for UPS and Amazon. Both know the meaning of customer service. Keep up the good work.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn P. Dobson

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money!
customer_reviews.text: Wore for about a month. Worst pair of shoes I've ever bought. Walmart's $18.00 pair lasted for a long time! Propet advertising states "good for heavy walkers". It's a farce! The heel collapsed after 2-3 weeks. The sole is peeling. I wrote to the Propet company, and no response after the generic email return! Don't waste your time or money!
customer_reviews.author: Jason B. Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems to have declined with white color not very good, some light staining and the fit a little narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Clarke C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe and really nice look!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size smaller than my New Balance shoes and these are still roomy enough for my orthotic inserts. The 5E width gives me more room in the toe box, which I like. Once I re-adjust to the orthotics, I'm sure these will be all day shoes. They also look better, a bit more formal than my New Balance and Altras.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Naulin

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are very roomy in the toe box, comfortable, and offer good support. The removable insole has a good arch and molds itself to the contours of your foot. The shoes were comfortable all day from the first day I put them on, so I didn't need to do the "wear them for 2 hours per day" break-in treatment. In fact, the third day I owned them I wore them to work - on a concrete floor for 12 hours, and had no problems at all. This is definitely my new favorite shoe.
customer_reviews.author: MIchael

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit like previous ones I have.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this style shoe for over 10 years. Same style, same size, same width. This is the first pair that were not wide enough. I can hold one old shoe sole to sole with a new one and the new ones are slightly narrower than the old one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dunston

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get any better
customer_reviews.text: This is my all-time favorite shoe that Propet makes. Those of us who have non-standard size/width feet really need these. I prefer the nubuck suede leather upper construction over the molded plasticy/rubber uppers. I just got done returning a pair of Propet's that I didn't like at all because of just that, they simply didn't fit, same size/width, but felt wrong and very unyielding compared to these. Please don't stop making these! I'm sure many others love them as much as I do!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit, awkward gait
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these I put my orthotics in and they felt very comfortable and sturdy. Yet when I walked in them the shoe falls flat and and slows my stride. My brother asked if there was something wrong with me because I was "walking funny". I put the original insets back in and it improved only slightly. These shoes might be just right for someone with a different gait, but I think I'm going to figure out how to shave some edges down to make my foot land more comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Rice

customer_reviews.title: PROPET
customer_reviews.text: SHOE FIT AS EXPECTED-8.5EXWW MENS ORDERED-HAVE GOTTEN THIS SIZE FREQUENTLY-THIS SHOE FITS ME WELL WOULD DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS SHOE ESPECIALLY FOR PEOPLE NEED WIDE SHOE
customer_reviews.author: diligent

customer_reviews.title: Two Weeks Report: A-OK
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to say the endurance test of durability is still to be reported, but this early report is important. These shoes for walking are better than my two Rockport walkers and any Nike I have had. I walk two miles of power walking every day, and these shoes are magnificent to get me anti-pronation and comfort. The landing and push off are perfect. Saves my knees, which are my issue. The only thing I haven't conquered is tight lacing to hold them snug at the ankle. I use an insole which creates a challenge for all shoes to be as snug as I like. But these are great and reasonably priced. As I said, better by far than Rockports.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence38

customer_reviews.title: Stiff but fit is good
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and sizing. Very stiff shoe. Im still breaking it in
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Roughness at the seams, hopefully it will wear-in
customer_reviews.text: Not a 5 star shoe as delivered. I am hoping that they might "wear in" with time. There are rough places in each shoe. I will be wearing them on carpet for several more days before I decide if they are acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: MJK

customer_reviews.title: I won’t get screwed again.
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike paying $99.95 for these shoes, finding out the 5 E width is more like an E, setting up a Prime free return only to be told my refund will be about $25 less than what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kliner

customer_reviews.title: Nice and wide
customer_reviews.text: For someone who actually has EEEEE wide feet, these shoes are a Godsend. They are a perfect fit. I have always just suffered wearing wide or if I could find them, extra wide shoes. They were always too small and would eventually rip open on the sides after a few months. I just bought a second pair of these and they were just as good a fit as the first. As long as they are in business, I will keep buying these till the day I die.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Glad I took a chance on theses.
customer_reviews.text: Really like these shoes. Was buying New Balance but these fit well and are easier on the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: My husband has very painful feet and has seen many doctors for his problem. They advised surgery for (tarsal tunnel: like carpal tunnel-but in the feet region). We don't have the luxury of him taking two to three months for recovery of surgery, nor can we afford the $800 orthopedic shoes that doctors prescribe. Upon receiving and wearing these sneakers, he says the pain in now lessoned. I believe the design with extra width is a contributing factor to his now "Comfortable" shoes. "Thank you very much" I am hoping the durability will withstand time. Definitely a product that we would "need" to buy again in the future. Great product/great service!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn P.

product_meta.title: Propet M2034 Men's Stability Walker Sneakers Leather Shoes
product_meta.description: One of our most popular models, this walking shoe is designed with a wider forefoot and heel base, for the ultimate in stability. The pu insole features a heel pad and cushioning ridges for superior comfort. Features a full-grain perforated leather upper.
feature_bullets: Fit: This style tends to run small. For an accurate fit we recommend purchasing a 1/2 size larger than you typically purchase.
